sen.j: 姓ははじめは臣であったが、八色の姓により朝臣に列せられた。
sen.e: At first the kabane (the hereditary title used in ancient Japan to denote rank and political standing) of Ono clan was omi (one of kabane which were more than thirty); then by the reformed kabane system yakusa no kabane (collective term for eight official titles conferred upon nobles by Emperor Tenmu in 684) the clan's kabane became ason.

sen.j: 小野氏は、遣隋使となった小野妹子をはじめ、遣唐使などを務めたものが多く、東北や九州などの地方官僚などを務めたものも多い。
sen.e: Including ONO no Imoko who became Kenzuishi (title for an envoy sent to Sui court in China), many people from Ono clan worked as officials who establish relations with China; for example, many people from Ono clan became Kentoshi (title for Japanese delegations sent to the Tang court in China); also many people from Ono clan worked as local officials in such regions as Tohoku and Kyushu.
